item.title: Push-To-Talk (PTT) Switches – Control Wheel PTT Switches

numlitem.para: Associated audio selector panel or glareshield PTT switch is operative, and
Affected switch is deactivated.

note.para: Use PTT on Audio Selector Panel.

placard.para: Placard affected Control Wheel Medallion "PTT SW INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the inoperative control wheel PTT switch.
For the CAPT control wheel PTT switch, open these circuit breakers on the overhead circuit breaker panel, P11 and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags:
11C25, INTERPHONE CAPT FLT AMPL DUAL PWR.
11G31, INTERPHONE CAPT FLT AMPL DUAL PWR.
For the First Officer’s control wheel PTT switch, open these circuit breakers on the overhead circuit breaker panel P11 and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags:
11C26, INTERPHONE F/O OBS DUAL PWR.
11G32, INTERPHONE F/O OBS DUAL PWR.
Remove the medallion screw and the medallion with chart holder.
Remove the cap-nut and pull out the wire bundle to get access to the disconnects.
Use extraction tool M15570-20, or M81979/14-02, or CIET 20-1 or equivalent, to disconnect the wires mentioned below from the quick-disconnect terminals.
To deactivate the R/T control PTT switch, cap and stow the PINK AND WHITE/RED wires from the terminals.
To deactivate the interphone control PTT switch, cap and stow the WHITE/ORANGE and RED/BLACK wires from the terminals.
Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags and close the associated circuit breakers previously opened.
Verify the control wheel PTT switch is deactivated by accomplishing ONE of the following operational tests:
Provide electrical power on the aircraft.
Select BOOM on the ASP and use the boom microphone for this test.
Push the INT SELECT switch on the associated ASP, ensure the INT MIC light illuminated and the receiver volume is properly adjusted.
Speak into the boom microphone while simultaneously pushing the deactivated PTT switch. No transmission should be heard on the other pilot’s headset.
OR
Speak into the associated pilot’s microphone while simultaneously pushing the ASP PTT switch. The transmission should be clearly heard on the other pilot’s headset.
Reinstall and secure all parts removed to accomplish above steps.
